value.title: Transpose, pivot or unpivot in Power Query?
value.excerpt: In todays video I am going to show you what Transpose, pivot and unpivot is and examples on when to use each or all at once!  If you want to learn how to import multiple files efficiently using Power Query, check this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qdcAoZU8B8Q  The file is avialable in the community

value.title: Deployment Pipelines give you more CONTROL (Power BI Premium)
value.excerpt: With Deployment Pipelines, you can control your application life cycle stages. Keep content in sync at the different stages of your development. Power BI Premium is required.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-overview https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-process

value.title: Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium
value.excerpt: In this video, Christian Wade joined Adam Saxton to discuss Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium. You can use Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium to take your dataset beyond 1GB and avoid failures such as timeouts.  Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium documentation - https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-premium-incremental-refresh

value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices.  Ideas: Power BI Designer for Mac https://ideas.powerbi.com/forums/265200-power-bi-ideas/suggestions/7546645-power-bi-designer-for-mac   Apple Boot Camp https://support.apple.com/boot-camp

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is

Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect

value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. value.title: Become Better with DAX- No More Struggles!
value.excerpt: Learn how to create advanced DAX calculations by mastering the fundamentals.

topItems.title: How to Use CALCULATE in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/B6w0IeLMZok" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Year over Year and Month over Month Calculations in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to quickly produce time intelligence calcution in Power BI using these easy to follow DAX equations. Elevate your time series analysis.

topItems.title: DAX Table Functions: ALL, FILTER, & VALUES
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.

topItems.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qiLjmKoP9ag" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Embed Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to embed Power BI into your site or application. This list has videos that are related to the different embedding options for Power BI. This includes Publish to web, the REST APIs and the Power BI Embedded Azure service.

topItems.title: What is Power BI Embedded?
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam, from Guy in a Cube, walks through what Power BI Embedded is. He talks about how you can get started with Power BI Embedded as well as what resources are available for you.  From the Azure portal to sample applications, along with documentation for APIs and usage of features, Adam
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iEHfUuoZseo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Create Power BI Embedded capacity in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam, from Guy in a Cube, walks through how to create Power BI Embedded capacity in the Microsoft Azure portal. He also takes a look at some of the actions you can do within the Azure portal such as scaling and pause/start.  Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/mspowerbi  More questions?
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aXrvFfg_iSk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Create Power BI Embedded capacity in Microsoft Azure

topItems.title: 3 ways to embed Power BI
topItems.excerpt: In this video, we will look at three ways that you can embed Power BI into your website or application. This includes the Publish to Web feature, using the REST APIs and the new Power BI Embedded service within Microsoft Azure.  Watch the behind the scenes video over on Guy in a Cube - https://youtu.be/OqbVZfFhEzA
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/egP0GHSOUIM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: A look at the new Power BI embed sample
topItems.excerpt: This video takes a look at the new Power BI embed Sample that you can use to learn how to use the JavaScript API. With code examples and comments to give you a feel for what you need to do.   Report Embed Sample: https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/code-demo/index.html  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Get started with Power BI Paginated Reports
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to create your first Paginated Report for Power BI, Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services.

topItems.title: Getting started with Power BI Paginated Reports (2021)
topItems.excerpt: Not sure what Power BI Paginated Reports are or how to use them? Patrick walks you through and points you to some great resources to get up and running quickly.  Power BI Paginated Reports require either Power BI Premium Per User or Power BI Premium capacity.  Paginated Report In a Day: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/learning-catalog/paginated-reports-online-course

topItems.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

topItems.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data

topItems.title: How to create Sparklines, indicators and conditional formatting in Power BI Paginated Reports
topItems.excerpt: Patrick walks finishes his look at Paginated Reports in Power BI. He shows you how to create sparklines, indicators and conditional formatting within the Paginated Report using Report Builder.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

topItems.title: Previous year up to a certain date

This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. Article and download: https://sql.bi/352723?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

topItems.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX

Start with Introducing to DAX free course: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/introducing-dax-video-course/ Go deeper with Mastering DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/mastering-dax-video-course/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: Power BI Conditional Formatting By Another Column
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to use Power BI conditional formatting by another column in Power BI Desktop. Using conditional formatting by another column can help you provide context which leads to faster insights. Power BI capability arrived in the May 2018 release of Power BI Desktop.  LET'S

value.title: Power BI Row-Level Security And Where To Filter
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI Row-Level Security And where to filter. He found that, after applying dynamic security, customers showed up in a slicer when they should not have. Challenge accepted! He walks through Power BI Desktop to show how he fixed his Row-Level Security problem.  LET'S

value.title: The How and Why of Power BI Aggregations
value.excerpt: Learn the how and why Power BI Aggregations can help your data model be more efficient. This video is part of a Power BI Aggregations series. value.title: Working with Time Periods in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do you work with time periods in Power BI like last month? Patrick digs in to show how you can accomplish this with a little DAX.  Fourmoo Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2016/09/07/create-dynamic-periods-for-fiscal-or-calendar-dates-in-power-bi/  Phil Seamark Blog: https://dax.tips/2019/10/09/row-based-time-intelligence/

value.title: How to Easily Change the Data Source Type in Power BI
value.excerpt: Watch till the end to find out how you can switch your Power BI model without redoing a lot of work from using .csv or .xls files to directly using the SQL server. value.title: Append vs Merge in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Combining two queries in Power Query or in Power BI is one of the most basic and also essential tasks that you would need to do in most of data preparation scenarios.
